title: 7+1 : Towards a Green Development Breakthrough in Slovenia

author: Vida Ogorelec, Umanotera, Slovenska fundacija za trajnostni razvoj

segmentation: So what I propose to share today was not something that is directly related to the model of Integral Slovenia that you have presented, but something that stems from a series of independent initiatives here that does, I think, have strong links to what we have been shown in his great potential for integrating into the broader model, which is which is the green aspect.
A bit it has implications for other dimensions as well, so the presentation is in two parts.
The first part is the 7 and then the last part.

To act successfully.

Our GDP in terms of damages just last year.

Those are the segments of the market and the sectors that are consistently growing.
So there is an opportunity in this context as well worldwide.
Nationally.
An important aspect to consider in Slovenia is a huge asset.
With that we have with our forests for one.
The forest cover and the potential of using timber with a higher value added than we currently do 'cause we export a lot of raw timber.
So that is 1 aspect of the economic potential of the forest.

In Slovenia, but the error aspect that I find talking about inspiration and grounding, who we are, the tradition of sustainable forest management in Slovenia that we've had for over 200 years is something that we can learn from as an example of sustainable management of a resource, whether in common ownership as you talked about the Commons.
With private ownership it is very inspiring so that it's not just the quantity of our forests, but it's also the quote quality, which really is up to sustainability standards.
Pretty much things to this tradition of sustainable forestry management.
I think this can be seen as sustainability in practice with this long term dimension that producer amulets reffered to the need for looking at things in the long term.

So how to create the highest value added?
On our natural, sustainable resource.

3rd One energy renovation, refurbishment of buildings, the energy efficiency of the housing stock, end of public buildings in Slovenia is fairly low within the European average and this creates a lot of possibilities for conserving energy, climate targets and economic opportunities as well.

Transition to renewable energy sources, so to connect energy efficiency with renewable energy production, Slovenia is is really rich in variety of renewable energy sources from hydro, which we currently have a third in our energy mix.
2 solar, two geothermal, little bit of wind and bio mass, of course, which preferably should be just waste from the wood processing.
M 51 in transport we did just try it.
Modernization of railway networks and public transport, but it is broader than that.
Also cycling paths and just promoting non motorized mobility #6 efficient use of natural resources so to move towards circular or cradle to cradle economy where there is no waste.
Modeled on ecosystems where somebody is wasted somebody else's food.
So industrial symbiosis the type of an economy and 7th one which kind of brings them all together in a way is the green tool tourism.
We've seen, in Dog's first slide the dis living in tourist office is actually his position.
Slovenia is green destination, but just printing green leaflets, of course, is not enough.
So there is with substance behind and all the other six programs obviously support at the green tourism vision very thoroughly.
What those programs bring in terms of.
Applications for one, they focus on solutions rather than on the problems, so they can be inspiring from Bantam and long term solutions.
They respond to Slovenian strategic opportunities in this international context and our natural resources, they reduce our dependence on imports in terms of food and energy.
In particular, they create jobs that are regionally balanced and.
They support climate target.
Implementation they will increase competitiveness through a.
Better efficiency.
And what's more important is what we've talked about.
The need for a positive vision at the moment.
Where is this country moving?
Where we could kind of all rally behind and identify with this kind of a vision?
But it's also promotes innovation in kind of when you said it releases the creative potential ones, the people will identify with the vision it creates.
Generates a lot of creative, creative energy.
It contributes to creating an economy of meaning.
So not just jobs for the sake of jobs, but jobs for the sake of fulfilling some of our basic needs.

Weekly results up-to-date.

There was really surprising interest of the media, so we had quite an extensive media coverage and we actually do still do now and then.
A public recognition of this is actually viable.
This green no longer is something that is protecting the environment, but something that is actually vision for the economy as well.
Green is one of the priorities.
As we have seen, not just thanks to our initiative, but of course there was, I think, considerable.
Assistance to this and also at the regional level.
There has been a lot of interest and we are now participating running workshops at the regional.
We did on the 25th of April hand over the signature signatures to the Prime Minister, who is more preoccupied at the moment with a very short term.
While the president is conducting the process, Slovenia 2030, the Prime Minister said her project is Slovenia 2013 because she needs to focus on balancing the budget and fixing the issue with.

The banks, but one area that I would specifically just briefly like to show to you that is in addition to the seven programs that is more of a systemic nature is the need for a green budget reform to not only to support these programs, but facilitated transition.
Hopefully there will be an opportunity for an event on this topic in the near future where we can present.

He's working on the 1st catalogue of environmentally harmful subsidies in Slovenia, where the need to balance the budget could actually be connected with getting rid of a lot of subsidies that harm the environment that.
Are remnants of a former area.
These this is the framework of the green budget reform and the areas that it supports.
So in.
In the comprehensive Green budget reform, the idea was to make it.
Revenue neutral.
So when the green taxes increase, labor taxes should be reduced, so we should be taxing.
The beds rather than the goods.
In today's situation where we have this deficit, of course the green taxes could actually contribute to fill.
This gap between the spending and the revenues of the Slovenian budget, and he didn't mean addition to that we could.
Some some of our.
Subsidies, just an overview of the potential of the environmentally harmful subsidies.
This is still in the making a little bit, so this is just preliminary findings.
Nearly half a billion euros is spent in these three sectors.
Energy transport and agriculture in environmentally harmful subsidies.
There is, you know, more specifically, I don't want to go into this now, but there is.
Huge potential to combine.
In the balancing of the budget, also a transition towards greener SoC and we'll see.
So far we haven't been very successful with this, but the idea is to increase the VIA text.
So increase the revenues without looking at the quality of the taxes and the quality of the spending so much.
So, just as a brief contribution, thank you for your attention.
